summary: The Health Care Freedom and Choice Act (S. 2641) aims to nullify a federal rule concerning Short-Term, Limited-Duration Insurance and Independent, Noncoordinated Excepted Benefits Coverage. The bill, introduced by Mr. Johnson in the Senate, seeks to invalidate the interagency rule published in the Federal Register on April 3, 2024, by the Internal Revenue Service, the Employee Benefits Security Administration, and the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. The stated goal is to ensure the rule has no legal effect.
